notes: question was added by NIMH group

question_ML: Where are you having pain?
notes: question was added by NIMH group

question_ML: How severe is your pain right now?
question_ NIMH: Are you in pain right now (other than headache pain)?
notes: In the NIMH version, there was a question named 'now-pain' that read 'Are you in pain right now (other than headache pain)?'. The responses to this question were in the form of a 1-7 likert scale, with 1 = 'no pain', 7 = 'extreme pain'. May be similar enough to merge with the ML version question in some cases

question_ML: Have you experienced any pain since you woke up/since the last questionnaire?
question_ NIMH: Have you experienced any pain (other than headache pain) since you woke up/since the last questionnaire?
notes: In the ML version, 'other than headache pain' was removed from the question

question_ML: Where did this pain occur?
How severe was the pain you experienced since you woke up/since the last questionnaire?
question_ NIMH: How severe was the pain you experienced since you woke up/since the last questionnaire?

question_ML: Have you experienced a **headache** since you woke up/since the last questionnaire?
question_ NIMH: Have you experienced a headache since the last questionnaire?
notes: In the NIMH version, this question was given conditionally on the user saying 'no' to having a headache currently. In the ML version, the question is given unconditionally, with the distinction of current/past headache being made by the question 'headache-current'. In the morning assessments, this question will no longer say 'since you woke up' in order to cover headaches that occur overnight. The timing of the headache can be inferred from 'headache-start',  'headache-end', and 'headache-current'

question_ML: Is this the **same headache** that you reported in the last questionnaire?
notes: question was added by NIMH group

question_ML: Since you woke up/Since the last questionnaire, did you do any of the following to **prevent a headache**?
question_ NIMH: Since the last questionnaire, did you do any of the following to prevent a headache?
notes: In the NIMH version, this question was given conditionally on the user saying 'no' to having a headache since the last questionnaire. In the ML version, the question is given unconditionally. In the morning assessments, this question will no longer say 'since you woke up' in order to be consistent with the wording of 'headache'. The question was renamed from 'prevention-action' to 'headache-prevent'.

question_ML: What time did the headache **begin**?
question_ NIMH: What time did the headache begin?
notes: In the ML version, this question is conditionally  given on 'headache-same' = 'no' to avoid redundancy. In the NIMH version, responses are given in 60 minute intervals via single select, in the ML version, responses are given at the minute level via clock widget

question_ML: Is this headache **still present**?
notes: The NIMH version of 'headache-end' had  'Headache is still present' as the first choice. In ML, this first option was removed an turned into a new yes/no question 'headache-current'

question_ML: What time did the headache **end**?
question_ NIMH: What time did the headache end?
notes: The NIMH version of 'headache-end' had  'Headache is still present' as the first choice. In ML, this first option was removed and turned into a new yes/no question 'headache-current'. In the NIMH version, responses are given in 60 minute intervals via single select, in the ML version, responses are given at the minute level via clock widget

question_ML: How **intense** is (or was) the headache?
question_ NIMH: How intense is (or was) the headache?
